net.coderazzi.filters.gui.editor
Class ChoicesListModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.AbstractListModel
      net.coderazzi.filters.gui.editor.ChoicesListModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, ListModel
public class ChoicesListModel
extends AbstractListModel

List model to handle the choices in the popup menu.

When the user specifies a Renderer, choices are considered non-text; otherwise, content is converted, if needed, to Strings, and sorted. This class includes functionality to find the best match for a given string, returning the choice that more closely matches the input. This functionality works only for text input (i.e., no Renderer specified)

The model handles also specifically CustomChoice instances, which are placed at the beginning of the list, sorted by their own precedence.

By design, it is not expected to have many CustomChoice instances associated to an editor; searching for a custom choice from a given string is done therefore linearly -with obvious performance drawbacks in cases with many many custom choices-.

See Also:
Serialized Form

 boolean addContent(Collection addedContent, IParser escapeParser)

If the content is text-based, the choices are converted into Strings, and sorted; if escapeParser is not null, choices are also escaped.
Otherwise, no sorting is performed, although duplicates are still discarded

public String getCompletion(String base,

Returns the text that could complete the given string
The completion string is the larger string that matches all existing options in this model or the added list.

addContent

public boolean addContent(Collection addedContent,
                          IParser escapeParser)
Adds additional choices.
If the content is text-based, the choices are converted into Strings, and sorted; if escapeParser is not null, choices are also escaped.
Otherwise, no sorting is performed, although duplicates are still discarded

Returns:
true if there are any changes after the operation
